message.content:
cs.SI, cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.SD, cs.IR 

The paper discusses measuring intellectual diversity in publication records, which is a topic that falls under the scope of several sub-categories in computer science. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely category as the paper uses a network model to measure diversity. cs.DL (Digital Libraries) is also likely as the paper discusses using the Stirling index to measure diversity in publication records. cs.CY (Computers and Society) is another possible category as the paper discusses the research performance of Hungarian organizations. cs.SD (Software Engineering) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are less likely but still possible categories as the paper discusses measuring diversity in research profiles and publication portfolios.
